dublin_core.dcvalue: A case report is presented of a 55 year old patient diagnosed with a demyelinating disease of unclear etiology The patient had Lyme borreliosis in 2004 Specific IgG antibodies against B burgdorferi s l were detected in the serum Intrathecal antibodies were not found in the cerebrospinal fluid but the presence of B garinii DNA was confirmed by PCR analysis It can be hypothesized that the borrelial persistence in the body may have been one of the triggers of the autoimmune process resulting in demyelination of the central nervous system CNS
Epidemiologie, mikrobiologie, imunologie : casopis Spolecnosti pro epidemiologii a mikrobiologii Ceské lékarské spolecnosti J.E. Purkyne
[Lyme borreliosis and demyelinating disease of the central nervous system].
